newFeatures.title: [Due Date 5 Feb] HSA: Support Coupon Images for Standalone Manual Coupons
newFeatures.description:
As a client creating manual standalone coupons
I want to upload an image when creating a coupon
So that the coupon can be visually represented and retrieved with its image through the Coupons API.

Currently, standalone manual coupons do not support images. This enhancement will allow clients to attach an image when creating a manual coupon.
The uploaded image will be stored and associated with the coupon and returned as part of the coupon data in the GET Coupons API.

This enables richer coupon presentation across client applications and channels.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria

Coupon Creation

  • Clients can upload an image when creating a new manual standalone coupon.

  • The image is optional and does not block coupon creation if not provided.

  • Supported image formats and size limits are validated during upload.

  • The image is successfully stored and linked to the created coupon.

Coupons API Retrieval

  • The GET Coupons API returns the coupon image as part of the coupon payload.

  • The response includes:

    • A publicly accessible image URL

    • Coupons without an image continue to return successfully without image data.

Data Model & Consistency

  • The coupon entity is extended to support an image field without impacting existing coupons.

  • Existing coupons remain unaffected and do not require migration.

  • Image data is returned consistently across all coupon

related endpoints where applicable.

Backward Compatibility

  • No breaking changes are introduced to the existing GET Coupons API response.

  • Clients consuming the API without expecting image data continue to function normally.

Validation & Error Handling

  • Invalid image formats or sizes return a clear validation error.

  • Upload failures do not create partially saved coupons.

  • Appropriate error messages are returned for unauthorized or invalid requests.

Documentation

  • API documentation is updated to:

    • Describe the new image field

    • Specify supported image formats and size limits

    • Include example requests and responses

  • Manual coupon creation guidelines reflect image support.

newFeatures.title: [HSA] Create Merchant API
newFeatures.description:
As a developer integrating with Gameball

I want an API that allows me to create a merchant

So that I can register merchants programmatically using a merchant ID and merchant name.


Currently, there is no dedicated API endpoint to create merchants.
This feature introduces a new API that enables clients to create a merchant by providing the required merchant information:

  • Merchant ID

  • Merchant Name

This API will allow merchants to be managed programmatically and used across configurations such as coupons, redemption rules, and filtering.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria

API Endpoint

  • A new API endpoint is available to create a merchant.

  • The endpoint accepts the following required fields:

    • merchantId

    • merchantName

Validation Rules

  • merchantId is required and must be unique.

  • merchantName is required and must be a non

empty string.

  • Attempts to create a merchant with an existing merchantId return a validation error.

  • Invalid or missing fields return descriptive error messages.

    • Data Persistence

    • Successfully created merchants are persisted and available for use across the system.

    • The merchant can be referenced immediately after creation in related configurations and APIs.

newFeatures.title: Bulk Customer Data Update via CSV Upload
newFeatures.description:
As a Gameball client,
I want to update my customers’ points, levels, or attributes in bulk by uploading CSV files,
So that I can efficiently manage large-scale customer data updates without needing to make individual edits or API calls.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria

CSV Upload Options

  • Clients should be able to upload CSV files for updating customer data through the Gameball dashboard.

  • Each data type should have a dedicated upload option:

    • Points Update

    • Tiers Update

    • Attributes Update

  • The system should support multiple CSV uploads within the same interface (e.g., separate files for each data type).

File Validation

  • The system should validate uploaded CSVs based on:

    • File type: Only .csv is accepted.

    • File size: Maximum of 10 MB per file for web uploads.

    • Row limit: Maximum of 100,000 rows per upload.

  • If the file exceeds the size or row limit, an error message should be displayed:

    “File exceeds the maximum allowed size of 10 MB or 100,000 rows. Please split your data.”

Processing Behavior

  • Once validated, uploads should be processed asynchronously as background jobs.

  • Clients should receive:

    • A progress indicator during processing.

    • A success or failure notification upon completion.

  • If any rows fail validation, clients should be able to download an error report CSV containing:

    • Customer identifier

    • Error message / field validation issue

Data Handling

  • Updates from the CSV should follow existing business logic for updating points, levels, or attributes.

  • Each successful row should be reflected in the customer profile after processing.

  • Partial successes (some valid, some invalid rows) should not block the entire file.

Error Management

  • Invalid rows should be skipped and reported without stopping the full file upload.

improvements.title: Include Refund Transactions in Order Transaction Logs API
improvements.overview:
As a developer integrating with Gameball’s Orders API
I want refund transactions to be included in the order transaction logs response
So that I can retrieve the complete history of all financial actions related to an order through a single endpoint.


The endpoint

GET /api/v4.0/integrations/orders/{orderId}/transactions

currently returns transaction logs related to an order, including redemption transactions. However, refund transactions associated with the same order are not included.

This enhancement will extend the response to include refund transactions, allowing integrators to access a full, chronological view of all financial activities related to an order.

whatsNew.title: Changes
items:
weight:600;">Acceptance Criteria

Functional Requirements

  • The endpoint returns all transaction types associated with the given order, including:

    • Earn transactions

    • Redemption transactions

    • Refund transactions

  • Refund transactions are included in the same response payload as other transaction types.

  • Refund transactions are clearly identifiable via:

    • A transaction type or action field (e.g., refund)

    • Relevant metadata (e.g., refunded amount, reference transaction if applicable)

Response Behavior

  • Refund transactions appear in the transaction logs using the same data structure as other transactions where applicable.

  • The response maintains a consistent schema to avoid breaking existing integrations.

  • Transactions are returned in a clear and predictable order (e.g., chronological by transaction date).

Backward Compatibility

  • Existing consumers of the endpoint are not impacted by the change.

  • No existing response fields are removed or renamed.

  • Integrations that do not rely on refund data continue to function without modification.

Data Accuracy & Integrity

  • Refund transactions returned are correctly linked to the specified order ID.

  • Refund amounts and timestamps match the source

truth financial records.

  • Partial refunds (if supported) are returned as distinct transactions.
